intro: Thesium pungens, commonly known as the spiked thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its spiny, cylindrical stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually green or yellowish. Thesium pungens is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in open grasslands or along coastal areas.
